question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Duplicate children] Can an InternalNode be encoded with duplicate child nibbles (e.g., two children at index 0x05), corrupting binary search lookups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Child version inconsistency] Can child nodes have versions greater than their parent's version, violating temporal consistency and enabling time-paradox attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Child hash mismatch] Does decode_value() validate that each child's hash matches the actual hash of the child node stored at that NodeKey, or can hash mismatches corrupt Merkle proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Leaf node as internal child] Can an InternalNode have a child marked as Leaf in leaf_bitmap but the child's NodeKey points to another InternalNode, breaking tree invariants? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Proof fabrication] Can encode_value() be exploited to store nodes with manipulated hashes that pass Merkle proof verification but contain fraudulent state data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Placeholder hash abuse] Can an attacker inject nodes that use SPARSE_MERKLE_PLACEHOLDER_HASH inappropriately, creating fake empty subtrees that hide existing state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Proof path manipulation] Can nibble path encoding be exploited to create alternative proof paths to the same leaf, enabling proof forgery attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Node hash recomputation] If node hashes are not validated against content during decode_value(), can an attacker inject pre-computed hash collisions to forge state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Leaf hash collision] Can two different LeafNodes with distinct (StateKey, value_hash) pairs produce identical leaf node hashes, enabling state aliasing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Cache key collision] Can two different NodeKeys encode to the same byte representation, causing cache poisoning where wrong nodes are returned from LRU or versioned caches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Decode cache bypass] Can an attacker craft encoded keys that bypass cache lookups, forcing expensive database reads for every state query? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Large node DOS] Can encode_value() create extremely large serialized nodes (e.g., InternalNode with 16 children with maximum metadata) that exhaust memory during cache operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Deserialization cost] Can repeated decode_key()/decode_value() operations on maliciously crafted keys cause CPU exhaustion, degrading validator performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [SeekKeyCodec] [Shard isolation breach] Can encode_seek_key() be manipulated to access nodes from different shards simultaneously, bypassing shard locking and causing race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Cross-shard key collision] Can nodes from different shards have colliding encoded keys when stored in the metadata database, corrupting top-level nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Shard migration] Does the schema support online shard rebalancing, or can changing NUM_STATE_SHARDS cause catastrophic key remapping failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Shard routing determinism] Is shard ID calculation from nibble path deterministic across all validator nodes, or can implementation differences cause shard routing divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Premature pruning] Can the schema be exploited to prune nodes that are still referenced by unpruned versions, causing state query failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Stale node retention] Can NodeKey encoding allow old-version nodes to evade pruning logic, causing unbounded database growth? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Pruning atomicity] Does batch deletion of pruned nodes maintain Merkle tree consistency, or can interrupted pruning leave partial trees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec + ValueCodec] [Snapshot inconsistency] Can a malicious snapshot provider send nodes with mismatched encoding that pass initial validation but cause state root mismatches later? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [KeyCodec] [Snapshot replay attack] Can old snapshots be replayed by manipulating version numbers in encoded keys, rolling back syncing nodes to outdated state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [ValueCodec] [Partial snapshot] Can incomplete node sets (e.g., missing child nodes) be accepted during snapshot restore, leaving validators with corrupted incomplete trees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [RocksDB key order] Does the schema rely on RocksDB lexicographic key ordering, and can this assumption break with different RocksDB configurations or versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/jellyfish_merkle_node/mod.rs] [Schema] [Column family compaction] Can RocksDB compaction operations cause temporary key unavailability or reordering that violates Merkle tree consistency? (High)
